instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02773: What is 820-02773? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S2: What is PP3V3_S2? PP3V3_S2 is a typo of PP3V3_S3.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma. no any liquid damage, board is in pristine condition. i don't have any history of the macbook. i opened it first time.i don't have brd and shematics for this model. couldn't find on web. first i did visual inspection and i found blown capacitor and i checked and line was shorted.(don't know name of shorted line) after remove capacitor shor was gone but still 5v 0.02ma. now i am checking voltages ( i am using <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> brd)

now i found same model working board and compared that line which was shorted and removed capacitor.  working board have 5v and my faulty board have low voltage 2.2v. so as i think problem is coming still from there.in diode mode both have same resistance to ground 450.anyone know which line is this?

p.s   now i checked UC710 and   <SIGNAL>PP3V3S2_EN</SIGNAL>  also have 0v instead of 1.8v.   also i checked other working board and this board must have 20v on charger even if uc710 is removed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
Schematic available for download on badcaps forum.
Boardview may be available on XinZhiZao server.

Consult the schematic and come back with detailed information.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
thanks for info. i just bought that sw. so damaged capacitor was <CAPACITOR>C8430</CAPACITOR>.  <SIGNAL>PP5V_MPMU_BSTLQ_XW</SIGNAL>. and now this line have 2.2v instead of 5v. i think its <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> problem.can you advice me something else?

1)  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>  12.28v
2)  <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL>   3.8v
3)   <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>      0v
4)  <SIGNAL>P3V3S2_SW</SIGNAL>    0v
5)  <SIGNAL>P3V3S2_EN</SIGNAL>  0v
6)   <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL> 0V
7)  <SIGNAL>P3V3S2_DSCHG_EN_RC</SIGNAL>  3.45V
8)  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S2</SIGNAL>    0v
9) <SIGNAL>PP1V25_S2</SIGNAL>  0V
10) <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_USBLS1_ISNS</SIGNAL>  0V
11) <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2SW_SNS</SIGNAL>        0v
12) <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_LDO</SIGNAL>       0v
13) <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_WLBT_ISNS</SIGNAL>   0v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground on that line with good board, if possible.
Also check all <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>'s LDOs in page 38.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
good board/faulty board format


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>  12.28v      480/480

<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL>    3.8v      157/322                so in this line bad board have high value not low!

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>        0v     402/401

<SIGNAL>P3V3S2_SW</SIGNAL>    0v        402/301

<SIGNAL>P3V3S2_EN</SIGNAL>     0v       703/701

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL>        0V     336/336

<SIGNAL>P3V3S2_DSCHG</SIGNAL>

_EN_RC     3.45V       523/535

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S2</SIGNAL>         0v     435/388

<SIGNAL>PP1V25_S2</SIGNAL>     0V       243/242

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>USBLS1_ISNS</SIGNAL>  0V     445/439

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2SW_SNS</SIGNAL>   0v   493/499

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_LDO</SIGNAL>       0v    445/439

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_WLBT_ISNS</SIGNAL>   0v   402/403

343S00554

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
We don't have any certain information about M2 components compatibility yet.
For M1, PMUs are interchangeable for 14" and 16".

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.02ma
threads.message: but m1 pmu maybe isn't interchangeable to m2 yes ?

If they have the same layout, you can try.
